decks.notes: This vintage 1 vs 1 combo Doomsday deck focuses on efficiently setting up and resolving a Doomsday spell to win the game. The deck includes various card filtering and tutoring spells to find key combo pieces like Thassa's Oracle and Street Wraith, along with disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck also includes fast mana in the form of Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate the combo. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game through a powerful Doomsday pile.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Underworld Breach to create powerful combos by casting spells from the graveyard. The deck includes various cantrips and card draw spells to find the combo pieces quickly, as well as counterspells to protect the combo from disruption. By utilizing cards like Brain Freeze and Gush, along with the Breach itself, the deck aims to win the game by milling the opponent's deck or generating infinite mana loops. With a mix of card advantage, protection, and combo potential, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources and slow down their strategy by playing hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter. It also includes cards like Kataki, War's Wage and Luminarch Aspirant to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes mana denial cards such as Ghost Quarter and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to establish early board presence and control the game tempo while chipping away at the opponent's life total with aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal while utilizing cantrips and card draw to maintain card advantage and dig for key spells. It also leverages cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of powerful restricted cards like Time Walk, Ancestral Recall, and Dig Through Time give the deck explosive potential, while the mana base supports the deck's three-color requirements. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of tempo plays and efficient threats.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck utilizes the powerful card Underworld Breach to enable various combos and win conditions. The deck contains several spells and cantrips to dig for key pieces while also protecting the combo with counterspells. The deck also features mana acceleration to cast spells quickly and efficiently. With the help of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to create powerful loops and storm off to victory using cards like Brain Freeze and Ancestral Recall.

This deck focuses on deploying powerful artifact creatures and locking down the opponent's resources with cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Sphere of Resistance. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and the Moxen, as well as lands like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Wasteland also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and give the deck a strategic advantage in the matchup.

This Jeskai Xerox deck focuses on using efficient spells and card advantage to control the game while applying pressure with creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor. The deck utilizes powerful blue cantrips and counterspells alongside cards like Dack Fayden and Narset to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card draw, removal, and disruption, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and establish dominance on the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful vintage cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk adds additional firepower to the deck's already potent strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible while disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim helps tutor for key pieces while Karn, the Great Creator can shut down artifact-based strategies. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with Mishra's Workshop and fast mana artifacts like Black Lotus and moxen. With the combination of Dark Depths, Thespian's Stage, and Mirage Mirror, you can create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just a few turns to close out the game.

The deck focuses on disruption and resource denial through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to control the game early on with cards like Narset and Leovold, then transition into a more aggressive strategy with Tarmogoyf and Oko. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its versatile threats and powerful spells. It seeks to maintain tempo and advantage throughout the game, utilizing a combination of efficient spells and strong creatures to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with cards quickly, enabling powerful combos and synergies. By utilizing cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can consistently dredge and bring back key creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba. Cabal Therapy and Unmask are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Creeping Chill provides additional reach. Bridge from Below and Bazaar of Baghdad are key components to generating advantage and overwhelming the opponent with an explosive swarm of undead creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with artifact creatures and disrupting opponents with artifact hate cards. By leveraging the power of Mishra's Workshop and powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and taxing effects like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. The inclusion of mana acceleration and disruptive elements allows the deck to execute its aggressive game plan while controlling the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game by stacking the deck with key cards like Thassa's Oracle and then drawing the win condition card. The deck utilizes a mix of cantrips, tutors, and disruption spells to protect the combo and ensure a fast and efficient win. It also includes powerful cards like Time Walk, Ancestral Recall, and Force of Will to further enhance its strategy. The goal is to efficiently execute the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victory in competitive Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using a combination of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, along with disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Force of Will to control the game and pressure the opponent. It also utilizes versatile cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Collector Ouphe to disrupt the opponent's strategy while advancing its own board state. The deck aims to maintain a balance between aggressive plays and control elements, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and strategies in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, enabling a powerful combo engine. It includes various cantrips and powerful spells such as Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Brain Freeze to generate card advantage and win the game quickly. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's game plan. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and resilience to the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this Combo - Dredge Vintage deck is to utilize graveyard interactions to quickly fill the battlefield with creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Hollow One. By dredging cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can trigger effects from cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy. With cards like Unmask and Noxious Revival to disrupt opponent strategies, along with the powerful land Bazaar of Baghdad for added card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly through synergistic plays involving graveyard interactions.

This deck is focused on assembling the combo of using Doomsday to set up a win with Thassa's Oracle. It includes a mix of card draw, tutors, disruption, and fast mana to quickly find and execute the combo. The deck aims to control the game early on while searching for the right pieces to assemble the combo and win the game in a single turn. It is crucial to carefully plan out the Doomsday pile and ensure protection against disruption to successfully pull off the combo and secure the win.
